pros: Excellent coworkers with team spirit
cons: Long hours but great lunches

pros: Used to be a family atmosphere
cons: Look where they are now

pros: they aren't open any longer
cons: poor management and bad business decisions

pros: I've been working at Little River for almost 5 years now.   It is a very family friendly business that allows me to still be a mom while being business orientated at the same time.  The atmosphere is great.  Management is helpful and strive to help you succeed.  It feels more like you are part of a big family instead of an employee in a big office.  Benefits are great.  There is always work to be done so the days are never boring.  I could not be more pleased with my decision to become part of the Little River Family.
cons: No cons at the present time.

pros: In 8 months, I can't think of a single thing. Im miserable every day as is every staff member
cons: Everything. Entire departments have disappeared overnight. A certain manager has threatened & ran off every competent employee. Pay scale is based on the rate of pay in ROCKDALE not Austin. The company makes tens of millions a months but laid off hundreds of good people. In my life i have never been in such a toxic company.

pros: Little River Healthcare is a GREAT company to work for.  LRHC is very committed to the patients and employees. The managers are great and will listen to any questions you may have and help with obtaining an answer.  Every department works together to make sure the patients are taken care. This company is very compassionate all the way around. They offer competitive and pay and awesome benefits. I would strongly recommend LRHC to family, friends and anyone else as a job seeker and patient.
cons: If your job happened to be relocated there is a possibility you would have a longer drive than usual.

pros:
I have to say for being with the company for five months now I have not had any issues with Little River. 
The hiring process was simple, I applied for the job and with in a few days I had a call from HR and they were setting up my interview, then in a matter of a week I started my new job. I have to say my co-workers and higher management are very respectful and make it were it is an enjoyable place to be.
cons: I do not have any cons at this time

review_title: If you don't work near Austin, TX you are non existent.
pros:
Decent benefits 
Decent pay
It seems like the people in or around the Austin area are well taken care of.
cons:
Not enough focus on outlying employees.
I had issues setting up my insurance. I signed on with one system and then switched to another 2 months later which set me back on my first 90 day count which I think is wrong.

pros: Excellent specialists were brought in
cons: Made many promises that weren't kept. Completely inept when it came to billing practices, which hindered income and to keep the facilities running.  Upper management had no clue what was going on and didn't seem to notice the huge losses that were piling up.  How do you miss that kind of revenue and not question it ?

pros: I have been with Little River just over 2 years and I couldn't be happier. I started expecting just another job and have grown with Little River and plan to remain here until I retire in 30+ years. Little River takes care of its employees in every way, from how we are treated to the benefits available.
cons: Distance between locations sometimes hinders team building

pros: Great people to work with.   Small town atmosphere where you know the CEO, providers, ancillary staff and all the staff behind the scenes that keep things working and clean
cons: Healthcare as an industry is going through some tough financial times.

review_title: Rewarding to work with patients of all ages.
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Wells River, VT
pros: Patients and teammates were great
cons: Management is out of touch.  Turn over is very high. They manage on rumor not facts

pros: The  physicians are great.  Very skilled and have a lot to offer.
cons: Senior leadership is lacking.  Leadership in general at most locations is lacking.  They don't seem to be  in the quality healthcare business.  Very disorganized company.  Lack vision, knowledge and truthfulness.

review_title: Used to be a great  place, not any more
pros: Great doctors, great employees,  hours ok
cons: Now a hospital based clinic, fees for patients/insurance are higher; no raises this year

job_title: Patient Accounting Representative in Bastrop, TX
pros: Great employees co workers to work with
cons: no raises in 2 years, management conflicts

pros: Great people, family feel, great doctors and nurses

pros: It was an available job
cons:
Shut down hospital after less than 15 months of management. This has wrecked our community. LRHC purchased every neighboring clinic within 50 miles, when the hospital shutdown, the clinics have struggled to re-open

Terrible wages

Gross negligence of supervising managers

Insurance fraud runs rampant

Uneducated people in high positions

Did not pay PRO or severance
